title: Rumors Of A Reaper
opening: The monastery is shocked to learn that Seteth's younger sister, Flayn, has gone missing. After an exhaustive search for clues, you finally come upon a lead...

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Professor... Please, allow me to express my eternal gratitude once more. Flayn is safe and sound, and I have you to thank for that. Mere words could never express how thankful I am. I...I am indebted to you.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I couldn't have done it without the students.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Yes, of course. I shall express my gratitude to the students as well.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I'm just happy she's safe.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Yes, indeed. I...I, too, am overjoyed.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: But why was Flayn taken to begin with?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Her kidnapper was the masked knight who vanished during the Rite of Rebirth. The one known as the Death Knight. Considering the circumstances, it seems plausible to assume that his true identity is Jeritza. And we cannot forget about the mysterious Flame Emperor... His true motives are yet unclear. However, I have an idea. I believe the enemy may have been after Flayn's blood. The blood that flows through her veins is special. It is extremely rare...and extremely dangerous. If enemies who know the secret of Flayn's blood have appeared, our only option is to leave the monastery and go into hiding.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: Brother, wait.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Flayn?! What are you doing here? You should be resting!

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: I do not like the path of your thoughts. I do not wish to live in some lonely, remote location where I never get to see anyone. Not ever again.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: If we stay here, you may be targeted again! Wouldn't it be better for the two of us to live in peace?

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: Even if we ran off to some new, secret location, there is no guarantee that they would not find us. That is why I believe it would be safest to stay in the monastery, where we are surrounded by capable knights and professors.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I see your point, I do. However...

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: You know it is the only reasonable option. What if I were to join the professor's class?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: That is a great idea.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: You think so too? I am so very pleased to hear that! With a professor like you nearby, I shall be safe no matter what foe should appear!

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Why would you do that?

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: Because, with a professor like you nearby, I shall be safe no matter what foe should appear!

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I see. I am afraid you have a good point. Professor... Due to my position, I have closely scrutinized everything about you. After all that has happened, I must admit that you are indeed...a trusted ally. So, what say you? Can I entrust you with Flayn's safety?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: It would be my pleasure.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I suppose I have no choice.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: I am so glad that Flayn is safe. Yet I can't help but wonder what the story is about the other girl. She wore the uniform of the academy. But who is she?

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Well done, Professor. I see that I was right to ask your class for assistance. I have been told that Manuela and Flayn are recovering nicely, as is Monica.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Is Monica a student here?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Who is Monica?

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Monica, the girl you rescued along with Flayn, is also a student at the Officers Academy. However...

dialogue.speaker: Hanneman
dialogue.line: She is a student from last year's class. She went missing just before she would have graduated. It never occurred to us that something might have happened to her at the monastery. We assumed she had run away. I never dreamed that we would find her. Not like this.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Monica has asked to rejoin the Black Eagle House once she has fully recovered. Our enemies are still out there, so we must remain cautious and continue our investigation. However, we must also help the students to move on from this incident.

dialogue.speaker: Hanneman
dialogue.line: After all, the Battle of the Eagle and Lion will be held in Gronder Field next month.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Yes. The students will remember it for the rest of their lives. Please guide them so they may show us their best at the coming battle.

dialogue.speaker: Jeralt
dialogue.line: So, you'll be going to Gronder Field next month. You've never been there before, have you? There is unease in the western side of the Empire, but everything east of the capital, Enbarr, is stable. Well, there was a noble rebellion a short while ago, but it didn't amount to much.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What will you do next month?

dialogue.speaker: Jeralt
dialogue.line: I have my own mission. The church has always been quick to make use of those who work for them.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Will you come to the Battle of the Eagle and Lion?

dialogue.speaker: Jeralt
dialogue.line: Sorry, but I've got my own mission, and it's far from Gronder Field. The church has always been quick to make use of those who work for them.

dialogue.speaker: Jeralt
dialogue.line: What I'm more concerned about is finding out who among us is pulling the strings. Ever since the Rite of Rebirth, strange groups have been seen around Garreg Mach, and elsewhere too. There was also an incident where some knights investigating these suspicious strangers...turned up dead. Not that it's likely, but if something like that ever happens to me... Search this room. Every corner. Behind every shelf. I'm going to leave something for you.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Don't say things like that.

dialogue.speaker: Jeralt
dialogue.line: Don't get me wrong. I have no intention of dying. I know it would be too much to ask you to cheer up, but can you at least drop the serious...  Well, I'll be. Was that a smile just now?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I promise.

dialogue.speaker: Jeralt
dialogue.line: Don't just nod solemnly. There's nothing to worry about. I'm just being cautious. Then again, I guess you're always solemn.

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: Oh my... Just one small girl who's gone astray has caused all this. We cannot let this stand. You must do all you can to find out where's she's gone. Now ask around to see what information you can find. Come now! No time to waste!

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: We must begin our search for Flayn, Professor. If she ran off on her own free will, that's her business. But that may not be the case. For her sake, I suggest we assume that she was abducted and begin an investigation. Who benefits from kidnapping her? Let's gather all the information we can on anyone who's been acting strangely.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Manuela ran off with Jeritza's mask? Hmm... We'll have to speak with both of them. But where could Manuela be? Jertiza is likely at the training grounds or in his quarters on the eastern side of the knights' hall.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Flayn is missing... We should split up and search for her. There isn't a moment to waste. We must find her before it's too late.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: When I consider how Seteth must be feeling, my heart breaks. We must find Flayn as soon as possible. There are no signs of her having left the monastery, but we cannot safely rule out any possibility just yet. I'm wasting precious time standing about trying to think of a solution. I'll survey the monastery and see what information I can gather. There must be someone who has a clue as to Flayn's whereabouts.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: What? Professor Manuela ran off with Professor Jeritza's mask? I have a bad feeling about this... We must find them both at once! Professor Jeritza will be at the training grounds or his quarters. I believe the latter can be found on the eastern side of the knights' hall.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: I have thoroughly surveyed the entire monastery, and yet I have not found a single trace of evidence that suggests Flayn was abducted. Perhaps we must seek out personal recounts rather than physical evidence... In any case, we must hurry before something terrible happens.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: No sign of her leaving the monastery, eh? That is, assuming we can actually trust that information...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Oh, but I'm sure this space has no shortage of secret passages and hiding spots!

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: True. For now, there's not much we can do aside from making a thorough search of the monastery.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Let's ask around and see what we turn up. You never know who might have seen something.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Professor Manuela ran off with Professor Jeritza's mask? What could that possibly mean?

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Well, that's suspicious! Sounds like we should try talking to them.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Professor Jeritza is almost certainly in the training grounds or his quarters. Where was that again? Oh, over on the eastern side of the knights' hall.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Flayn's gone missing? Where could she be? If it were an ordinary kidnapping, you'd think there'd be a demand for ransom or something by now. I don't like the sound of this...

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: If Flayn has been taken hostage, then we know she is alive. At least for now. There would be no point to abducting her if simple murder was the objective. That's only logical, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: A beautiful, delicate maiden vanishing into thin air... It is like something out of a book. If it were a book, we would have no need to worry! She would be rescued presently by a dashing nobleman. Do you have any idea as to where she might be? Where she might have wandered off to?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Perhaps she went looking for treats?

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: That is what I thought! Why I am here, in fact. But she is nowhere to be seen.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: To the greenhouse, for some flowers?

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Hmm, the greenhouse. I did not think of that. I will take a look around there later.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Flayn? No, I haven't seen her. She's been abducted. Oh, you're looking for her. Sorry, my mind was somewhere else. I just recently learned she has a Crest. Did you know that, Professor? If it was a particularly rare Crest, I could imagine Professor Hanneman would have quite an intense interest in her. Oh, no, I'm not accusing Professor Hanneman of abducting Flayn.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: I don't know if she ran off or got kidnapped or what! I just know that Flayn's in trouble. That's it! I can't keep sitting around. I gotta go find her! Now where do I start?

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Uh, Flayn's not in here! Ugh, I guess I have to let you in to prove it, don't I?

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: There. See? No one's in Bernie's room but Bernie. Maybe Flayn just wanted to be alone for a while. Have you considered that? Come to think of it, where is her room, anyway?

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Hey, Professor, have you seen Manuela? I saw her running off somewhere in a terrible hurry. I wonder if it has anything to do with Flayn's disappearance. Do you know, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're on first-name terms with Professor Manuela?

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Oh, yes. Didn't you know? She was the senior diva in our Opera Company.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Flayn was childnapped. That is what you are thinking? And the villain is inside our monastery? Hmm. I must have admittance. One person...has been catching my eye. Shamir is a knight not like other knights. Her movements are being reminders of...no, they remind me of warriors of Brigid. Before she was here, what was she getting up to...

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: I've heard the monastery is full of secret passages. If there is no sign of Flayn's departure, it's possible that she used one of those. Whatever has happened, I hope she is all right.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Ah, you're looking for Flayn's kidnapper. I can't say anything for sure, but I do have suspicions about Jeritza. There's something about how he's handling his blade lately. It seems more...impulsive than usual. It couldn't hurt to try speaking with him, at least. At this hour, I think you'll find him sparring with Catherine at the training grounds.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: I heard something like this happened last year too. Neither the culprit nor the missing student were ever found last time. Some people say it was the work of evil spirits.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Maybe it was.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: D-don't say things like that, Professor! I'm sure the culprit is, you know, corporeal. We'll catch whoever it is!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Then it could be the same culprit.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: I thought the same. Could there be a connection?

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Ow! Ingrid just about slapped the teeth out of my head. All I did was suggest that Flayn had eloped...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Quite an insensitive joke.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Insensitive? I was just exploring possibilities!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Is that a possibility?

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I don't know. I was just suggesting things, then suddenly I was seeing stars and Ingrid was yelling at me.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Do you really think Flayn was kidnapped?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: She must have been.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I have a feeling you're right. We really need to find her, and quickly!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: There must be another explanation.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Do you think she ran off on her own? That doesn't put me any more at ease.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: There have been a lot of rumors swirling around lately about a Death Knight who kidnaps people from the nearby town... You don't think Flayn was...you know. Do you?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We can't rule it out.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't believe so.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Whether the rumors are true or not, I just hope our Flayn is safe...

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: To think that Flayn would disappear like this... Seteth must be worried sick. I haven't got much to go off of, and perhaps it's out of line for me to feel so uncomfortable... But something has been bothering me for a while about Gilbert. I feel as though I've met him somewhere before... I also noticed him staring intently at Annette once. Hmm...

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: If Flayn were taken hostage, I expect we would have received demands from the culprit by now. Perhaps this is not a kidnapping at all. Do you suppose she could have simply run away?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's possible.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: If that is the case, it is unlikely that we will find her anywhere in the monastery.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't think so.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: What could it be, then? What possible motive could there be to abduct her?

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: I hope Flayn isn't going hungry. If someone really kidnapped her, I'll never forgive them! Now that I think about it, I saw Alois hanging out by the pond not too long ago. He was always getting into trouble for trying to talk to Flayn, you know. It's probably a crazy thought, but I'm starting to worry.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I've only ever spoken to Flayn a handful of times. She always seemed so naive about the ways of the world. I'm worried about her.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You think she'd be easily deceived?

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: Yes, I'm afraid so. I just hope she comes home safe.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Do you have feelings for Flayn?

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: Wh-what makes you say that?! This is hardly the time for teasing, you know!

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Reflecting on it now, Flayn has always seemed a rather odd person. She appears young, yet there's something about her that seems much older than her years suggest. And she's quite wise, but also surprisingly naive...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Maybe she's lived a very sheltered life.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Hmm, you might be right. Whatever the case, Seteth seems to care for her more than anything.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Maybe she's actually a ghost.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: A ghost?! Don't be absurd!

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Dear Goddess, hear my prayer... Please watch over Flayn... Please protect her...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: I bet Flayn ran away. She couldn't stand being held back by Seteth any longer. I can emphasize. I know what it's like to have an overbearing big brother.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Where could Flayn have gone? Do you think she's really been kidnapped? I hear Tomas has been going around asking about her... But he's probably just worried like the rest of us. Though it wasn't just Flayn. He was asking about you and Captain Jeralt too.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: Professor, have you still not found any leads regarding Flayn's whereabouts? I have looked everywhere. Not even the knights on guard have seen anything of note.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're searching too?

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: I, too, care for Flayn. She is like family to me.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We will find her, together.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: Yes, let us work together. It reassures me to have you by my side.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: May the goddess protect dear Flayn until she returns to us...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I will find her. I swear it.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: That is all I ask. Please, lend me your aid!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Try not to worry.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: You ask the impossible. Oh, Flayn...

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: She would have never left the monastery of her own volition. Why is there not a trace of her to be found?!

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Hey there, Professor. Did you want to talk?  What?! Me, abduct Flayn?! You can't really believe I did that!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Did you find anything in the pond?

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Well, this may sound silly, but... I was too scared to even look. I couldn't bear the thought of finding her in its depths.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I hear she was always yelling at you...

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Oh, that's just because of my dumb jokes. She says that they're not very good. But if I went around kidnapping everyone who said that, the whole monastery would be empty!

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Did you hear about Flayn? It's just one thing after another this year, I swear. Some of the lower-ranked knights are searching for her in the town. If they find anything, I'll know.  What? Jeritza? Hm, come to think of it, I haven't seen him today. What would make you suspect him?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That mask he wears is suspicious.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I heard that he goes out every night.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: I see. Well, I'll let the knights know.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: What brings you here? I'm taking a break.  Is this about Flayn? You find me suspicious? Hah.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're not from Fódlan.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: True. Your point being?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What did you do before coming to the monastery?

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: I was somewhere else. Fighting. Is that a problem?

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: I understand that I don't fit in among the Knights of Seiros... But that hardly links me to Flayn's disappearance.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Working hard, aren't you? I'll admit, I'm impressed. I can assist with any tasks, or help with your students

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: On it. I'm available anytime I'm not on a mission with the knights.

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: Miss Flayn's whereabouts are unknown? I pray she is safe... We do not seem to have any leads at present.  I am one of the suspects, am I? Well, hopefully I can lay your suspicions to rest. Do you know of my, let's call it...unique situation?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Your true identity?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Do you mean Annette?

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: I was once a knight in service to the Faerghus royal family. If Ingrid believes she saw me before, it was likely in Fhirdiad, the Kingdom Capital. Annette is... She is my... But no, I would appreciate it, Professor, if you would ask no more.

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: Because of Flayn's disappearance, all of the knights are searching nonstop. But we haven't found a single lead. Seteth's face is getting paler by the minute. It's hard to watch.  What's that? You're looking for Manuela? Well, I did pass by her earlier. She was carrying something. A mask of some sort...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Jeritza's mask?

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: I'm not close to the guy, so I can't say for sure. But come to think of it, you could be right.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Flayn's mask?

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: Are you feeling all right? When have you ever seen Flayn wearing a mask?

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Young Flayn's disappearance is most troubling.  What? Who would suspect me? You know what? I'll tell you who. A fool. That's who.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Is her Crest rare enough to justify kidnapping her?

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Flayn's Crest, the Major Crest of Cethleann, is rare, but there are others who possess it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You have already investigated her thoroughly?

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Alas, Seteth would never allow that. However, while Flayn's Major Crest of Cethleann is rare, there are other who possess it.

conversation.speaker: Tomas
conversation.line: Is something the matter? I see. So, Flayn has gone missing. I will do what I can to support the search.  Hm? It seems that you are a bit suspicious of me. Might I ask your reasons?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Why were you asking about Flayn?

conversation.speaker: Tomas
conversation.line: I was away from the monastery for a few years, but do not forget... I have spent more than four decades in total working here at Garreg Mach Monastery. Yet it was not until recently that I learned that Seteth has a sister.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Why were you asking about my father?

conversation.speaker: Tomas
conversation.line: It has been two decades since I last knew Jeralt, yet he looks nearly identical to my memory of him.

conversation.speaker: Tomas
conversation.line: It is only natural to be curious, don't you think? I assure you, there is nothing more to it than that.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: I can't believe Flayn just disappeared. I don't like it one little bit. Oh, are you here to see someone? Alois and Shamir and all the knights are gonna head into town soon.

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Today...there is quite a bit to report! There is a masked individual who has been going into town every evening and not returning until the following morning. You see? Nothing gets past this guard! I doubt it has anything to do with Flayn's disappearance, but... Well, better safe than sorry, I always say.

conversation.speaker: Student
conversation.line: Professor! I saw him! A knight wielding a gigantic scythe! He was just like the rumors say! All covered in jet-black armor! It was the Death Knight, I just know it! You don't think he has something to do with Flayn's disappearance...do you?

conversation.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
conversation.line: I can only imagine how worried Seteth must be, but isn't mobilizing the entire order of knights a bit...excessive? I was originally assigned to investigate those reports of the Death Knight in the town near Garreg Mach. When I think how many more victims that dastard might claim while we're all busy searching for Flayn... I'm sorry... That was insensitive. We're all under a lot of stress right now. It's important that we find her quickly.

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: I've served here at Garreg Mach in some capacity or another for several decades now. But after all that time, even I can't claim to know everything about the layout. Searching the entire interior of the monastery is a more difficult task than you may think. It makes you wonder who designed such a titanic compound. There are fragments of records remaining from its original construction, but none of them name an actual architect...

conversation.speaker: Monk
conversation.line: This might be the first time I've ever seen Seteth look so worn down. If poor Flayn was lured away by anyone... I personally think the clear suspect is that miscreant from Duscur. Those people are deceptive by nature...

conversation.speaker: Student
conversation.line: The whole monastery has been turned upside down! I wonder if we're still going to have the Battle of the Eagle and Lion next month. It's a yearly tradition, but with things the way they are right now...it's hard to imagine. At any rate, I hope they find Flayn soon.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: I never would have imagined... Hm? I see someone. They're unconscious.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: Yes, and there is someone else too. It appears to be another student.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: No, Professor. It's two young girls.

intro.speaker: Caspar
intro.line: Someone's coming! I recognize that scythe and mask... It's that jerk we fought at the Holy Mausoleum!

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: What is this place? It's so...BAH! I see someone! I think...they're unconscious.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: Yes, I see Flayn! But...who is this other person?

intro.speaker: Felix
intro.line: Are you blind? They're obviously female. And there are two of them.

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: Professor! Someone's coming from farther in! That scythe... Is that the knight who attacked the Holy Mausoleum?

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: It's way too creepy down here. And it smells funny. And...BAH! A person! They're...unconscious.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Yes! It's Flayn! Oh, but there's someone else too...

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Look closer, Professor. There are two girls.

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Someone is coming! That scythe... Could it be the knight we fought at the Holy Mausoleum?

intro.speaker: Death Knight
intro.line: That sword. You must be... One of us will die, the other will live. I will enjoy this dance of damnation.

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: Our objective is to recover Flayn. Let us hope we are not too late.

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: Hmm. Something odd about the floor over there. What will happen if we step on it?

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: Contraptions in the floor. Stay alert.

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: Interesting apparatus. I wonder if we can operate it.

battle.speaker: Flame Emperor Soldier
battle.line: So, you have come! I'll make sure you never leave!

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: That knight looks like death itself. We must rescue Flayn immediately.

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: There's something strange about the flooring at the end of the corridor. Something might happen if you step there.

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: Some kind of contraption has been activated.

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: What is this device? It appears operational.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Professor, we need to defeat the Death Knight, and then rescue Flayn!

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Hm. Look at that strange tile over there. I bet something will happen if you step on it.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Whoa. Look at those weird contraptions on the floor.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: I wonder what that is? Looks like you can use it, but who knows what'll happen.

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: I have no need of you...

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: Now, you will die together... How joyous...

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: I don't take orders from you...

end.speaker: Death Knight
end.line: Kill them.
Halt. You're having a bit too much fun.

end.speaker: Death Knight
end.line: You are getting in the way of my game.
Hmph. You'll have more opportunities to play soon. Your work here is done.

end.speaker: Death Knight
end.line: Understood. I will go...
We will cross paths again. I am the Flame Emperor... It is I who will reforge the world.

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: Flame Emperor? Rather worrisome that he sounds intent on showing up again.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: Are they both OK? We should get them out of here.

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: The enemy's withdrawn. Let's carry them up.

end.speaker: Mercedes
end.line: Flame Emperor and the Death Knight? I have to say, they both looked very dangerous.

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: Where did they go? It doesn't matter. We need to get these two out of here.

end.speaker: Dedue
end.line: Bring them up.

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: Flame Emperor, eh? Seemed quite frightened of us if you ask me! Haha!

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: He's gone. We should get these two out of here.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Let's get out of this horrible place! C'mon, we can carry them up.

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: They're pale, and their pulse are slow... Still, I don't believe their lives are in danger.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: You found Flayn? Where?!

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: You missed the most important part of the mission! We found her within that secret passage. The culprits were the Death Knight and...what was his name? Ah, the Flame Emperor. Sadly, they got away.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: All that matters is Flayn's safety. Right, Professor?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Right.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I wanted to catch them.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: It is unfortunate. If only you could have waited for me to return...

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: We will take these two to the infirmary. Professor, please inform Seteth.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Whatever the circumstance, I'm glad Flayn is safe. Though I'm curious to find out who that other girl is... Huh, Professor? Is that...a smile?

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Heh, you look...happy. I don't think I've ever seen you like this before. Anyhow, we should hurry to Seteth. He must be beside himself by now.

end.speaker: Mercedes
end.line: Thank goodness. Those girls are pale as ghosts, but at least they're alive. But that Death Knight person...feels so familiar.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: You found Flayn?! Thank goodness!

end.speaker: Annette
end.line: She was unconscious at the end of that secret passage. We found the culprit too...but he got away.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: No use dwelling on it.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: We almost had him.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: I'm just grateful that everyone is safe. That's what matters most. I'd like to hear what transpired, but first we need to get these ladies to the infirmary.

end.speaker: Dedue
end.line: Understood. We'll go at once.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: I'm...I'm sorry, Professor. I'm so relieved, I suddenly felt weak. I couldn't be happier with how things turned out. And I imagine no one will be more overjoyed than Seteth. Hm. Hey, Professor. Can you make that expression one more time?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Like this?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: I don't think I've ever seen your face like that.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: No.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I don't think I can...

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Heh, I apologize. I've forgotten myself and come dangerously close to teasing you. It's just...I've never seen you look so happy before. It's downright mesmerizing. Ah, but this isn't the time for idle chitchat. We must hurry and share the good news with Seteth!

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: They're both alive... Thank goodness.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: You actually found Flayn?! Nice work!

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: It is a shame you could not be there, Claude. I would have liked for you to witness our mortal struggle against the Death Knight.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: He got away.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: We could not defeat him.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Hey, at least we managed to rescue Flayn and complete our mission. That's what counts, right? Right! Excellent work, everyone! Now then, let's get these limp ladies to the infirmary, shall we?

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: No problem. I can carry them both at once.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Be gentle with them, Raphael! Let us carry each one individually. And slowly.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: You know, Teach, seeing you smile sure makes me feel better. You look happy for a change. Hm? Do you really not know? Well, truth is, I've never seen you smile before now. At times, it made me wonder whether you were even human. But I suppose that was just my imagination running wild. Anyhow, we've probably kept Seteth waiting about as long as he can stand. Let's hurry up and tell him the great news.
